results.title: Rikki-tikki-tavi
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
An animated version of Rudyard Kipling’s tale of a mongoose who is saved from a storm by a boy and his parents, and then becomes the family’s defender against the dreaded cobras that roam the compound. Narrated by Orson Welles. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: The White seal
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
Based on a tale in Kipling’s “The Jungle Book”, this exciting animated film follows the exploits of Kotick, the white seal, as he struggles to survive and save his friends from seal hunters in the Bering Sea. Narrated by Roddy McDowall to music from Beethoven’s Sixth Symphony. Teacher’s notes accompany the video.

results.title: Ohnar 16MM Editor Viewer
results.brief_description: Film viewing and editing devices like the Ohnar provided amatuer filmmakers the ability to precisely edit their own home movies with relative ease. Popular among avid consumer-level filmmakers for their size, this 16mm film equipment allows hand cranking and has a convenient frame counting dial. The reel arms can be swivelled out and locked in place for use, and folded away for compact storage.

group_siblings.title: 16mm projector
group_siblings.creator_credit: Ditmar
group_siblings.material_description:
-Ditmar 16mm projector no 2072
 - Internal cloth bound board used as a platform to store inside box.
 - Grey cord w Aus plug and a black cord w Euro plug.
 - Detachable feed arm
 - Huile Oil Ol original cardboard box and glass oil bottle inside.  The oil bottle still has 3 mm of oil at bottom which is fluid.  The cork lid of the bottle also has a tiny metal straw protruding from it to gather the oil.
 - Singer (brand) oil pourer with a removable nozzle.  Not from this set, but owner must have used it as one of many methods to oil the projector.
 - Tiny metal funnel for pouring oil into oil dropper.
 - One glass dropper with rubber end which is stored inside a cylindrical tube with lid.
 - One clear plastic dropper with remnants of oil inside top round squeezer.
 - Australian plug with nothing connected.
 - A small Euro plug which is backed on to wood and slots in the back of the machine.
 - An old paper rag
 - 2 spare belts in very delicate wax paper bags.  One of rubber (hardened) and one finely coiled metal (which has a kink in it).

results.title: Mowgli's brothers
results.creator_credit: Chuck Jones, Xerox Films and Chuck Jones Enterprises
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Kipling classic from ‘The jungle books’”.
Animated version of Kipling’s classic tale of a boy rescued and raised by wolves in the jungles of India comes alive in this film about love, justice and loyalty. Features the voices of Roddy McDowall and June Foray. Teacher’s notes accompany the video. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Starting Embroidery
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There are many beautiful and fascinating styles of embroidery practised around the world. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin; the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches, and some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon

results.title: 16mm Film
results.brief_description: Most of the films in our collection are held on 16mm film, which was introduced in the 1920s as a cheaper alternative to the 35mm format and was widely adopted by amateur filmmakers. Because of its accessibility and popularity, it’s no surprise that we receive so many donations from the community, which along with the film itself, also comprises editing equipment and cameras. The Hanimex Eiki 16mm film projector displayed in this cabinet is typical of the kinds used in schools up until the 1980s, where films were screened in assembly halls to supplement standard learning in classrooms.

results.title: Starting Crochet
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
Crochet is a soothing, rhythmic craft, practised throughout the world for thousands of years - using only a hook and a length of thread. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches; as well as some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

group_works.title: Telestreet: the Italian Media Jacking Movement

results.title: Starting Tapestry (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Maggie Clarke, Pat Marshall and MSI Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world and the techniques are easy to learn at any age. “Starting tapestry” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities tapestry offers to everyone, young and old.
